The Voyage of Eärendel the Evening Star

wikitext.*:
{{year-header}}
==Early==
* '''?''' - [[Edith Tolkien|Edith Bratt]] converts to Catholicism and becomes engaged to [[J.R.R. Tolkien]].
==January==
* '''[[6 January|6]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] begins working on ''[[The Book of Ishness]]''.
* '''[[10 January|10]]''' - Scholar [[Angus McIntosh]], pupil and friend of [[J.R.R. Tolkien]], is born.
* '''[[30 January|30]]''' - The [[Chequers Clubbe]], founded by [[J.R.R. Tolkien]], is given permission to organize dinners.
* '''?''' - ''[[Rules of the Exeter College Essay Club]]'', signed by [[J.R.R. Tolkien]], is printed.
==February==
* '''[[14 February|14]]''' - Translator [[Britt G. Hallqvist]] is born.
==June==
* '''[[1 June|1]]''' - [[George Sayer]], friend of [[J.R.R. Tolkien]], is born.
*'''[[18 June|18]]''' - The [[Chequers Clubbe]], founded by [[J.R.R. Tolkien]], meet to have dinner.
==August==
* '''[[4 August|4]]''' - The British Empire declares [[World War I|war]] on Germany, following tension and conflict on the mainland in July. [[Allen and Unwin|George Allen & Unwin]]'s offices are opened in London by [[Stanley Unwin]].
* '''[[9 August|9]]''' - Artist [[Tove Jansson]] is born.
* '''?''' - [[Hilary Tolkien]] joins the army as a bugler. 
* '''?''' - [[Geoffrey Bache Smith]] and [[Robert Gilson]] join the army. [[Christopher Wiseman]] joins the navy instead.

==September==
* '''[[16 September|16]]''' - Author and librarian [[William Ready]] is born.
* '''[[24 September|24]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes ''[[The Voyage of Eärendel the Evening Star]]''.

==October==
* '''[[1 October|1]]''' - [[Donald A. Wollheim]] is born.
*'''?''' - Tolkien, still undergraduate, is training at the Officer's Training Corps. He writes [[Letter 1]] to his fiancée [[Edith Bratt]].

==November==
* '''[[November 27|27]]''' - Tolkien writes [[Letter 2]].

==December==
* '''[[22 December|22]]''' - Tolkien writes [[Ferrum et Sanguis: 1914]].
* '''[[25 December|25]]''' - The [[T.C.B.S.]] meet in London.

==?==
* '''Spring''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] is awarded the Skeat Prize for English by the [[University of Oxford#Exeter College|Exeter College]]. He spends the £5 prize money on buying [[List of books in Tolkien's library|four books]].
* '''?''' - Artist [[Horus Engels]] is born.

{{Years|1911|1912|1913|1914|1915|1916|1917|}}
